title: How to Hack a Watermelon

steps.headline:

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b7\/Watermelon_4_199.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b7\/Watermelon_4_199.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":327,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":539.6,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}Place the whole watermelon into the refrigerator for one hour.
Remove from the refrigerator and slice the watermelon into chunks or sections.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/94\/Watermelon_6_328.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/94\/Watermelon_6_328.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":317,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":524.4,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Slice off the rind from each slice (the green and white part).
